snippet: Amid a growing perception that Mitt Romney will be the party’s nominee, the biggest of the Republican “super PACs” is set to begin its first major anti-Obama advertising campaign.
abstract: American Crossroads, the biggest of the Republican super PACs, is planning to begin its first major anti-Obama advertising blitz of the year, a moment the Obama re-election campaign has been girding for and another sign that the general election is starting in earnest; timing of the advertising push will give the campaign of Mitt Romney, the Republican front-runner, the time and cover to map out its national organization, replenish its bank account and put the finishing touches on its own long-discussed advertising plan.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY

lead_paragraph: Amid a growing perception that Mitt Romney will be the party’s nominee, the biggest of the Republican “super PACs” is set to begin its first major anti-Obama advertising campaign.

headline.seo: Major Republican Super PAC Prepares to Take On Obama
headline.main: ‘Super PAC,’ Eyeing General Election, Aims Blitz at Obama
headline.print_headline: With Eye on General Election, ‘Super PAC’ Aims Blitz at Obama
